alert.note: Alert for Northwest Plateau; West Central Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued June 25 at 2:42AM MDT until June 26 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FOR MONDAY AND TUESDAY AFTERNOONS THROUGH EVENINGS FOR THE NORTHWEST PLATEAU AND WEST CENTRAL MOUNTAINS DUE TO VERY LOW HUMIDITY, GUSTY WINDS AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .Increasing southwest flow across far western New Mexico in advance of a slow moving Pacific low will combine with an extremely dry and unstable atmosphere to produce rounds of critical fire weather conditions both Monday and Tuesday. Winds will trend up some Tuesday compared to Monday and extreme fire weather conditions are possible. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Fire Weather Watch...which is in effect from Monday afternoon through Monday evening. A Fire Weather Watch has also been issued from Tuesday afternoon through Tuesday evening. * AREA AND TIMING...The Northwest Plateau (Zone 101) and the West Central Mountains (Zone 105) Monday and Tuesday afternoons through evenings. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest 15 to 25 mph with gusts to 35 mph on Monday. Southwest 20 to 25 mph with gusts to 40 mph on Tuesday. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Ranging from 6 to 11 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.
